text: Kenan Kocak (born 5 January 1981) is a Turkish born, German former football player. He is the current manager of Hannover 96. ==Professional career== Kocak was a youth product of Waldhof Mannheim.http://www.footballdatabase.eu/football.joueurs.kenan.kocak.205839.en.html Kocak played sparsely for Waldhof Mannheim, Austria Salzburg, SSV Reutlingen, 1. FC Pforzheim, and finally as a player-manager for Türkspor Mannheim.http://www.weltfussball.de/spieler_profil/kenan-kocak/2/ ==Managerial career== ===VfR Mannheim=== In the winter break of the 2010–11 season Kenan Kocak became manager of VfR Mannheim.http://www.morgenweb.de/mannheim/lokalsport/kocak-ich-mache-nicht- alles-allein-1.269300 In his first competitive match as coach, his team was able to knock out the local rival of Waldhof Mannheim in the quarter-final of the Baden Cup.http://www.vfr-mannheim.de/teams/archiv/saisonstatistiken In the regular season, Kocak reached second place with VfR Mannheim in the Verbandsliga Baden.http://www.fupa.net/liga/verbandsliga-nordbaden-502.html In the promotion play-off, his team faced FV Ravensburg. The first leg ended in a 1–1 draw. The second match was won by Mannheim with 2–0. As a result, Mannheim reached the Oberliga Baden- Württemberg.http://www.morgenweb.de/nachrichten/fotostrecken/vfr-mannheim- feiert-oberliga-aufstieg-1.130360 In his first Oberliga season, Kocak's team finished in second place.http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/amateure/oberliga- baden-wuerttemberg/2011-12/0/0/spieltag.html After the first half of the 2011–12 season, VfR Mannheim was even at the top of the Oberliga.http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/amateure/oberliga-baden- wuerttemberg/2011-12/16/0/spieltag.html In the 2012–13 season, Mannheim finished in third place.http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/amateure/oberliga- baden-wuerttemberg/2012-13/0/0/spieltag.html After this season, Kocak left the club and became manager of Waldhof Mannheim, which played in the Regionalliga Südwest at the time.http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/regionalliga/startseite/587510/artikel_kocak- uebernimmt-das-ruder-beim-svw.html ===Waldhof Mannheim=== Waldhof Mannheim hired Kocak on 7 June 2013 and had his first match on 29 July 2013 against SSV Ulm. The final score was 4–2 for Waldhof Mannheim. The club finished the 2013–14 season in fifth place. In the following season, Waldhof Mannheim dropped down to 13th place. Waldhof Mannheim won the Regionalliga Südwest during the 2015–16 season. In the promotion play-off, they faced off against Sportfreunde Lotte. The first leg ended in a 0–0 draw and the second leg ended in a 2–0 win for Lotte. Kocak left Waldhof Mannheim on 3 July 2016 to become manager of SV Sandhausen. ===SV Sandhausen=== Kocak became manager of Sandhausen on 3 July 2016. Kocak's debut match was a 2–2 draw against Fortuna Düsseldorf. His first win with Sandhausen came on 22 August 2016 in a 2–1 win against SC Paderborn. He was sacked on 8 October 2018. ===Hannover 96=== On 14 November 2019, Kocak was appointed as manager of Hannover 96. ==Managerial statistics== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |- !rowspan="2"|Team!!rowspan="2"|From!!rowspan="2"|To!!colspan="9"|Record |- !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! |- |Waldhof Mannheim||7 June 2013||3 July 2016 | |- |SV Sandhausen||3 July 2016||8 October 2018 | |- |Hannover 96||14 November 2019||Present | |- ! colspan="3"| Total !— |} ==References== Category:1981 births Category:Turkish footballers Category:Turkish football managers Category:German footballers Category:German football managers Category:German people of Turkish descent Category:Austrian Football Bundesliga players Category:2. title: Kenan Kocak
